			<ul class="new-sidepanel-menu legal-ads-free">
	<li class="sidepanel-legal-ads-free">
    	<a href="https://optout.hearstmags.com/servlet/OrdersGateway?cds_mag_code=A99&amp;cds_page_id=246801&client_id=35hrtv401vr6kfniu4r980hkda">Do Not Sell My Personal Information</a>
    </li>
</ul>

<div class="simple-item top-pathing-item show-numbers">

			
			<a href="/military/aviation/a37156438/restoring-wwii-mosquito-plane/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Top Touts" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Restoring a Wooden WWII Fighter Plane" data-vars-ga-position="1" data-vars-ga-total-positions="5">
	
		











<div class="simple-item-image item-image">
						
	
						<img class="lazyload lazyimage" alt="" title="De&#x20;Havilland&#x20;DH.98&#x20;Mosquito&#x20;in&#x20;Flight"
				src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7"

				data-sizes="auto"
								data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mosquito-10-jpg-1640011474.jpg?crop=1.00xw:0.807xh;0,0.0773xh&amp;resize=160:* 160w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mosquito-10-jpg-1640011474.jpg?crop=1.00xw:0.807xh;0,0.0773xh&amp;resize=320:* 320w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/mosquito-10-jpg-1640011474.jpg?crop=1.00xw:0.807xh;0,0.0773xh&amp;resize=480:* 480w"
			/>

			</div>
			
</div>


		
			<div class="simple-item-index">
			1
		</div>

<header class="content-header listicle-header"><div class="affiliate-disclaimer bar-content-disclaimer ">
	<p class="affiliate-disclaimer-detail">
		Gear-obsessed editors choose every product we review. We may earn commission if you buy from a link.

					<a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/about/a29149305/popular-mechanics-gear-reviews/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/about/a29149305/popular-mechanics-gear-reviews/">How we test gear.</a>
			</p>
</div>

	
	<div class="content-header-inner">
		<h1 class="content-hed listicle-hed">100 Skills Everyone Should Know</h1>

					<div class="content-dek listicle-dek"><p>Nothing but the essentials.</p></div>
		
		










<div class="content-info listicle-info">
	<div class="content-info-metadata">
										



	<div class="byline-with-image">
		<div class="content-info-byline-image" aria-hidden="true">
								
	
						<img class="lazyload lazyimage" alt="" title="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/rover/profile_photos/8dff8f31-f2d4-42da-aa06-74f39262068c_1613514066.png?fill=1:1&amp;resize=80:*" data-sizes="auto" data-srcset=""></div>

				<!-- shared/byline -->

	





	<div class="byline " itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">By
					<a class="byline-name" href="/author/2813/popular-mechanics-editors/" rel="author" itemprop="url" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Byline" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Popular Mechanics Editors"><span class="byline-name" rel="author" itemprop="name">Popular Mechanics Editors</span></a>		
	</div>
<!-- / shared/byline -->

	</div>

		
						<time class="content-info-date" datetime="2018-08-08T13:00:00Z">
											Aug 8, 2018
					</time></div>

	</div>

	</div>
</header><div class="content-container listicle-container">
	<div class="listicle-body">

					











	<div class="content-lede-image listicle-lede-image">
				<div class="content-lede-image-wrap aspect-ratio-2x1">
				
	
						<img class="" alt="100 Skills" title="100 Skills" src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/100-skills-1533839238.jpg?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=480:*" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/100-skills-1533839238.jpg?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=480:*" data-sizes="auto" srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/100-skills-1533839238.jpg?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=640:* 640w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/100-skills-1533839238.jpg?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=768:* 768w,https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/100-skills-1533839238.jpg?crop=1.00xw:1.00xh;0,0&amp;resize=980:* 980w"><div class="image-credit content-lede-image-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Michael Stillwell</span></div>

					</div>
		
							</div>

		
		<div class="listicle-intro"><p>These days, you can outsource almost any job&mdash;but some things you need to know how to do yourself. Now you can explore how to perform life's essential skills. Study our master list with step-by-step tips from the experts, and test your DIY aptitude each step of the way.</p><p><em>The first edition of this story appeared in 2008. It has been updated.</em></p></div>

					  	<div class="breaker-ad mobile-breaker-ad listicle-breaker-ad listicle-mobile-breaker-ad">
				<div class="breaker-ad-text">Advertisement - Continue Reading Below</div>
		<div id="gpt-ad-vertical-top-mobile" class="ad-container"></div>
	</div>

		
		<div class="listicle-body-content   ">
							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="0">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">1</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Escape a Sinking Car</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbf1c1b3_-_100-skills-066-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbf1c1b3_-_100-skills-066-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="66. Escape a Sinking Car" title="66. Escape a Sinking Car" src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbf1c1b3_-_100-skills-066-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Escape%20a%20Sinking%20Car&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbf1c1b3_-_100-skills-066-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Escape%20a%20Sinking%20Car&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbf1c1b3_-_100-skills-066-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>The moment your car hits the water&mdash;or before, if you have the presence of mind&mdash;lower your window. (The electric motors should work, even in saltwater.) If the car floats for a few seconds, slither out the window. If it sinks right away, water will rush in and fill the interior. Sounds bad, but it's actually good: It equalizes water pressure, allowing you to open the door. If the windows don't open, "keep a tool like a spring-loaded center punch to break a door window," says Jamie Hyneman of the MythBusters, who escaped from a sinking car in an episode of their TV show. Co-host Adam Savage adds: "You're not always in your own car, so in that case the skill is not to panic as you hold your breath and wait for the car to fill with water."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="1">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">2</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Parallel Park</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc2aad51_-_100-skills-082-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc2aad51_-_100-skills-082-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="82. Parallel Park" title="82. Parallel Park" src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc2aad51_-_100-skills-082-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Parallel%20Park&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcc2aad51_-_100-skills-082-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Parallel%20Park&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcc2aad51_-_100-skills-082-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Use the parked car in front of the space as a guide. Start turning the wheel to the right when the side mirror lines up with the front car's front door. When the front seat is even with the rear bumper of the front car, straighten the wheel and aim straight back for the far corner of the space. When the right front bumper just clears the left rear bumper of the front car, cut the wheel quickly to the left and finish backing into the space. To straighten out, turn the steering wheel to the right and pull forward.</p><p><a href="http://www.roadandtrack.com/car-culture/a6324/useful-geometry-parallel-parking/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="http://www.roadandtrack.com/car-culture/a6324/useful-geometry-parallel-parking/">More: How to Parallel Park Perfectly Every Time</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="2">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">3</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Build a Campfire</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c436d3f2_-_25-skills-07-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c436d3f2_-_25-skills-07-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="7. Build a Campfire" title="7. Build a Campfire" src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c436d3f2_-_25-skills-07-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Build%20a%20Campfire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c436d3f2_-_25-skills-07-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Build%20a%20Campfire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c436d3f2_-_25-skills-07-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">eugeni_dodonov/Flickr</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>To find dry fuel, look for standing deadwood and broken branches stuck in tree limbs, says Tom Laskowski, director of Midwest Native Skills Institute. </p><p>Place the material next to your cheek; if it feels cool, it's too wet to burn efficiently. To fuel a 1-hour fire, gather two large fistfuls of tinder--such as cattail down and crushed pine needles--and about 30 twigs, 20 pencil-size sticks and 10 wrist-thick pieces. Form a tepee with three 6-in.-tall sticks and place smaller sticks on the floor as a platform for the tinder. </p><p>Lean the smallest sticks on the tepee, leaving a doorway to face the wind. Place the next size of sticks on top; repeat twice. Pack the tepee with the tinder and light it. Slowly add the 10 largest sticks in a star pattern.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: If it's raining, Laskowski uses a cotton ball smeared with Vaseline (or ChapStick) as a foolproof fire starter.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="3">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">4</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Fix a Bike Flat Tire</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c47a6f21_-_25-skills-24-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c47a6f21_-_25-skills-24-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="24. Fix a Bike Flat" title="24. Fix a Bike Flat" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c47a6f21_-_25-skills-24-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fix%20a%20Bike%20Flat%20Tire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c47a6f21_-_25-skills-24-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fix%20a%20Bike%20Flat%20Tire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c47a6f21_-_25-skills-24-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Once you remove the wheel, force the deflated tire off the rim, starting opposite the valve, then separate tire and tube. If the leak is a large tear, throw the tube out. To locate a pinhole leak, inflate the tube and feel for escaping air. If necessary, dunk the tube in water and look for bubbles.<br></p><p>Apply a patch over the hole. The repair should last the life of the tire. Before remounting the tire, wipe the inside of it clean with a dry cloth to remove any sharp objects that might puncture the tube. Then work the lip of the tire onto half of the rim. </p><p>Tuck the tube inside the tire, and insert the valve into its rim hole. Pump some air into the tube to reduce its chances of getting pinched between rim and tire. Then work the tire onto the rest of the rim, starting at the valve. Split the wheel into quarters. Work one-quarter down either side from the valve. Then repeat the process on the other half of the tire. This final step may require two bike levers.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="4">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">5</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Split Firewood</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb09bf40_-_100-skills-003-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb09bf40_-_100-skills-003-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="3. Split Firewood" title="3. Split Firewood" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb09bf40_-_100-skills-003-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Split%20Firewood&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb09bf40_-_100-skills-003-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Split%20Firewood&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb09bf40_-_100-skills-003-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Michael Lewis</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Seasoned splitters use a maul, not an ax, to prep firewood. (With its slim taper, an ax head often gets stuck in the end grain.) Don't use a chopping block&mdash;it reduces the arc of the swing, which decreases power. Instead, place the log on the ground, 5 in. closer than the length of the maul handle. </p><p>Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart; place your dominant hand at the bottom of the handle and the other hand three-quarters up the handle. Rest the maul on the wood, then lift it all the way up&mdash;your bottom arm should be straight and your top arm slightly bent. </p><p>As you begin the downward motion, slide your top hand down to your bottom hand. Use your whole body, not just your arms, and bend your knees slightly, snapping them back a split second before hitting the wood.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="5">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">6</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Wax a Car</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb2df204_-_100-skills-012-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb2df204_-_100-skills-012-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="12. Wax a Car" title="12. Wax a Car" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb2df204_-_100-skills-012-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Wax%20a%20Car&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb2df204_-_100-skills-012-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Wax%20a%20Car&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb2df204_-_100-skills-012-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Park the car in the shade, or work after sunset to keep hot sunshine off the paint. Wash the car thoroughly with a cleaner that won't strip off old wax, as household detergent does. Rub the wax on in a circular motion, one panel at a time. Give it a few minutes to haze up, then buff off with terry cloth or microfiber polishing cloths.</p><p><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/how-to/a10646/how-to-wax-your-car-16878051/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/how-to/a10646/how-to-wax-your-car-16878051/">More: How to Wax Your Car</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="6">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">7</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Paddle a Canoe</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.1250%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c47775ed_-_25-skills-23-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c47775ed_-_25-skills-23-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="23. Paddle a Canoe" title="23. Paddle a Canoe" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c47775ed_-_25-skills-23-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Paddle%20a%20Canoe&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c47775ed_-_25-skills-23-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Paddle%20a%20Canoe&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c47775ed_-_25-skills-23-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>For flat-water cruising, the sternman's J-stroke is key: It keeps the canoe tracking in a straight line. Reach forward so the "catch"--the start of the blade's pull through the water&mdash;is well in front of your knees. </p><p>At midstroke, the blade should be vertical and fully immersed. The upper arm extends diagonally across your body as though delivering a cross-punch and finishes on the outside of the gunwale (top edge of the canoe). The motion delivers power through a lever action; use the shaft hand initially as a fulcrum, then pull back on the shaft. </p><p>The second half of the stroke traces the hook of the letter "J." When you draw the blade out of the water, the power face (the side pulling against the water) is parallel to the canoe, with the thumb of your top hand pointing down. Your paddle is acting as a part-time rudder.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="7">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">8</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Chainsaw</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:62.0311%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/chainsaw-1525464586.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/chainsaw-1525464586.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="Chainsaw, Tool, Circular saw, Saw, Saw chain, Wood, Power tool, Cutting tool, Machine, " title="Chainsaw, Tool, Circular saw, Saw, Saw chain, Wood, Power tool, Cutting tool, Machine, " class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/chainsaw-1525464586.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Chainsaw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fhmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fimages%2Fchainsaw-1525464586.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Chainsaw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fhmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fimages%2Fchainsaw-1525464586.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Milwaukee Tool</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Chainsaws are extremely handy tools, but they are also unforgiving and demand your undivided attention when using. Follow these rules every time you use your chainsaw. </p><p>1: Stand properly using the boxer stance. For right-handed people, that means putting the left foot slightly in front and at a 45-degree angle, with the right foot slightly in back. Keep your feet approximately shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees.<br>2: Keep both hands on the saw, and never take your eyes off the bar as you cut.<br>3: Plan your cut so you know exactly where the saw's bar (note: it's called the bar, not the blade) will exit the log. As the old timers used to say: It's not where you start the cut that counts&mdash;it's where you finish. That is, you don't want to sweep right through the log, out the other side, and into your leg or foot.<br>4: Don't be caught by surprise when you feel the saw's pull. Cutting on the bottom of the bar pulls you toward the log, cutting on the top of the bar pushes you away.<br>5: Beware the <a class="body-link" href="http://www.husqvarna.com/us/support/working-with-chainsaws/work-tasks-with-risk-of-kickback/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="http://www.husqvarna.com/us/support/working-with-chainsaws/work-tasks-with-risk-of-kickback/">kickback zone</a>. Don't dig the bar into that zone.<br>6: Unless they're formally trained in chainsaw use, homeowners should always use a reduced kickback saw chain. Yes, it cuts more slowly than what the pros use, but it's much safer.<br>7: Wear appropriate safety gear: chaps, boots, gloves, and eye and hearing protection. <a class="body-link" href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/tools/reviews/a10006/so-you-have-a-chainsaw-heres-what-else-you-need-16400406/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/tools/reviews/a10006/so-you-have-a-chainsaw-heres-what-else-you-need-16400406/">Learn more here</a>.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="8">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">9</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">The Perfect Pushup</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc1a02ad_-_100-skills-077-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc1a02ad_-_100-skills-077-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="77. Drop and Give the Perfect Pushup" title="77. Drop and Give the Perfect Pushup" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc1a02ad_-_100-skills-077-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=The%20Perfect%20Pushup&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcc1a02ad_-_100-skills-077-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=The%20Perfect%20Pushup&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcc1a02ad_-_100-skills-077-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Feet should be no farther than 12 in. apart, hands about shoulder-width. "Your body is in a straight line from heels to shoulders," Kaplan says. Bend your elbows to lower your body as a single unit until your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Return to the starting position, with arms fully extended. Repeat until ordered to stop.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="9">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">10</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Bleed Car Brakes</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.1250%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c475161f_-_25-skills-22-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c475161f_-_25-skills-22-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="22. Bleed Brakes" title="22. Bleed Brakes" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c475161f_-_25-skills-22-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Bleed%20Car%20Brakes&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c475161f_-_25-skills-22-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Bleed%20Car%20Brakes&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c475161f_-_25-skills-22-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>When the brake pedal starts to feel spongy, it's time to bleed your brakes. Make sure all four bleeder bolts at the wheels turn readily, then use a turkey baster to suck old brake fluid out of the reservoir. </p><p>Clean the reservoir and fill to the brim with fresh fluid. Put a small hose on the bleeder to route the fluid into a container. Have an assistant depress the brake pedal. Open the bolt farthest away from the master cylinder a quarter-turn, then close it. Ask the helper to slowly lift his foot off the pedal, then depress it again, repeating until fresh fluid comes through the hose. </p><p>Top off the reservoir regularly. Repeat the process at the other three corners, then do all four corners again. ABS pumps may require bleeding as well; check the manual.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="10">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">11</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Move Heavy Stuff</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb98775e_-_100-skills-042-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb98775e_-_100-skills-042-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="42. Move Heavy Stuff" title="42. Move Heavy Stuff" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb98775e_-_100-skills-042-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Move%20Heavy%20Stuff&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb98775e_-_100-skills-042-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Move%20Heavy%20Stuff&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb98775e_-_100-skills-042-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>The favorite heavy-moving tool of Chris Wells, driver-owner-operator of A-Mrazek Moving Systems, is ... a blanket. "Tilt one end of the object up and bunch the blanket underneath, then tilt the other end up and pull the blanket through, so that the object is sitting on the blanket. Then it's easy to pull it wherever you want it to go."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="11">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">12</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Paint a Room</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c460558a_-_25-skills-17-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c460558a_-_25-skills-17-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="17. Paint a Room" title="17. Paint a Room" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c460558a_-_25-skills-17-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Paint%20a%20Room&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c460558a_-_25-skills-17-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Paint%20a%20Room&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c460558a_-_25-skills-17-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Good paint jobs start before the first can of paint is opened.</p><p>Prepare the room by removing all hardware (door latchsets, receptacle and switch plates). Don't just fill small holes in the plaster or drywall; enlarge them first so the compound can be pushed in place, and wet the hole to slow drying. Sand rough spots, wash dirty areas, then prime.</p><p>Paint the ceiling, then the walls. Use a 212-in. brush to cut in the finish color at all corners and against the trim. Switch to a roller, apply paint in a W pattern and fill it in. After you dip the roller in the paint tray, 70 percent of the paint comes off on the first downstroke; avoid splatters by starting at least 9 in. from the corner. Apply two coats.<br></p><p>Finish by painting the woodwork and trim with a gloss or semigloss paint. It's safest to mask off the walls beforehand, although pros often skip this step. If you do mask, use a tape designed for the purpose so the adhesive doesn't pull the paint from the wall. Once the final coat dries, reinstall hardware.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="12">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">13</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Find Potable Water</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb1598dd_-_100-skills-006-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb1598dd_-_100-skills-006-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="6. Find Potable Water" title="6. Find Potable Water" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb1598dd_-_100-skills-006-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Find%20Potable%20Water&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb1598dd_-_100-skills-006-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Find%20Potable%20Water&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb1598dd_-_100-skills-006-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Don't exert yourself in the heat of the day. You may lose more water by sweating than you'll gain by digging. Ravines and valleys are carved by running water, so head for the bottom. </p><p>In deserts, with only occasional flow, look for cottonwoods, willows and other light-green vegetation that grows in wet areas. When the sun or moon is low in the sky, scan the horizon for reflections that may reveal the location of small pools. (Don't worry if the water looks scummy. </p><p>Waterborne illnesses won't kick in for at least three days; dehydration can kill in a single day.) Collect morning dew by wiping grass with a cloth, then wringing out the water. If you have plastic bags, wrapping them around the boughs of deciduous trees yields 1 or 2 ounces a day.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="13">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">14</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Get a Car Unstuck</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c457bb8d_-_25-skills-15-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c457bb8d_-_25-skills-15-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="15. Get a Car Unstuck" title="15. Get a Car Unstuck" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c457bb8d_-_25-skills-15-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Get%20a%20Car%20Unstuck&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c457bb8d_-_25-skills-15-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Get%20a%20Car%20Unstuck&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c457bb8d_-_25-skills-15-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>When you're stuck, don't gun the engine to get out--the tires will only dig in deeper. Instead, straighten the steering wheel, then dig out as much sand, snow or mud from around the front or rear of the tires as you can, depending on the direction you want to go. </p><p>Place a floor mat snugly under a portion of each drive wheel (if your vehicle is 4wd, position a mat under each wheel). Ease the vehicle onto the mats. If there's a passenger, have him push the vehicle in the direction you want to go. Repeat the procedure as needed, slowly progressing in the direction of travel until the vehicle is free.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: To maximize traction, lower the tires' air pressure by 10 to 15 psi or until the sidewall begins to bulge. This spreads out the footprint of the tire, helping the vehicle float over terrain. Drive slowly and air the tires back up as soon as possible.<br></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="14">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">15</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Fillet a Fish</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c44e3233_-_25-skills-13-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c44e3233_-_25-skills-13-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="13. Fillet a Fish" title="13. Fillet a Fish" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c44e3233_-_25-skills-13-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fillet%20a%20Fish&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c44e3233_-_25-skills-13-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fillet%20a%20Fish&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c44e3233_-_25-skills-13-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Set the scene with a flat surface and an appropriate knife--any long, thin, flexible and sharp blade will do, but for larger fish you might need a stiffer blade. Make your first cut behind the pectoral fin or gill cover, angling the tip of the knife slightly toward the head.<br>Cut down to the spine, but not through it.</p><p>Next, turn the fish end to end and run your knife head to tail along the dorsal fin and backbone, pushing the knife deep enough to bounce the blade off the fish's rib cage.</p><p>Then run the knife carefully over the rib cage until you reach the spine. Pull the fillet back as you cut, which will help you see what you're doing.</p><p>Repeat the process through the bottom half of the fish, and you're done with that side. Flip and repeat for two boneless fish fillets.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: "One side of the fish is always easier to cut than the other. It's a matter of physiology: Right-handed people find it easier to cut from left to right; lefties, vice versa. Do the harder side first. The fullness of the fish will make it easier to control on the cutting board." </p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="15">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">16</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Back Up a Trailer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c4342f58_-_25-skills-06-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c4342f58_-_25-skills-06-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="6. Back Up a Trailer" title="6. Back Up a Trailer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c4342f58_-_25-skills-06-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Back%20Up%20a%20Trailer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c4342f58_-_25-skills-06-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Back%20Up%20a%20Trailer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c4342f58_-_25-skills-06-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>If you're doing this without a spotter, put your left hand at six o'clock on the steering wheel, and drape your right hand over the seatback. As you back up, move your steering hand in the direction you want the trailer to go.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: "If the trailer is too low to see, tape sticks or flags to the rear corners."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="16">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">17</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Shoot Straight</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbfd91c2_-_100-skills-069-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbfd91c2_-_100-skills-069-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="69. Shoot Straight" title="69. Shoot Straight" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbfd91c2_-_100-skills-069-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Shoot%20Straight&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbfd91c2_-_100-skills-069-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Shoot%20Straight&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbfd91c2_-_100-skills-069-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>When you spot your deer, take a deep breath, hold it and aim. (Your nonsighting eye should be closed.) Exhale halfway, then hold your breath again. Now comes the first commandment of riflery: Thou shalt not jerk back the trigger finger. Instead, squeeze with a steady pressure until the trigger releases. "The idea is not to disturb the gun," says former Olympic rifle coach David Johnson. "You should actually be a bit surprised when the gun fires."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="17">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">18</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Sharpen a Knife</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c4467050_-_25-skills-11-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c4467050_-_25-skills-11-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="11. Sharpen a Knife" title="11. Sharpen a Knife" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c4467050_-_25-skills-11-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Sharpen%20a%20Knife&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c4467050_-_25-skills-11-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Sharpen%20a%20Knife&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c4467050_-_25-skills-11-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Use a combination stone that has a coarse side and a fine side. The trick is to hold the blade at the correct angle. According to Bob Montagno, an expert sharpener and plant manager at Norton Pike (the first American sharpening-stone maker), most European blades have a 22- to 25-degree blade. "That's about the angle of a book of matches," Montagno says. "Japanese knives and fillet knives are 12 to 15 degrees."</p><p>First, lubricate the coarse side of the stone with mineral oil or water; then push the blade across in a sweeping motion, like you're cutting a thin slice off the stone. "Flip the knife and work the other side until a slight burr forms along the edge," Montagno says. "Switch to the fine side of the stone, lift the blade to a slightly higher angle and hone off the burr to create a razor-sharp micro bevel."</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: Stroking each side of the beveled edge at the honed angle on a steel (the rodlike tool in carving sets) straightens microscopic distortions.</p><p>More: <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/food-drink/a13150392/how-to-sharpen-kitchen-knives/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/food-drink/a13150392/how-to-sharpen-kitchen-knives/">The Right Way To Sharpen Kitchen Knives</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="18">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">19</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Change Oil and Filter</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.1250%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c46ba0e8_-_25-skills-20-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c46ba0e8_-_25-skills-20-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="20. Change Oil and Filter" title="20. Change Oil and Filter" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c46ba0e8_-_25-skills-20-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Change%20Oil%20and%20Filter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c46ba0e8_-_25-skills-20-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Change%20Oil%20and%20Filter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c46ba0e8_-_25-skills-20-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Every 3000 miles you can commune with your car when you change the oil. Warm the engine to stir up any sediment in the crankcase, then raise the car on stands or ramps. Put a pan under the drain and re-move the plug; let it drain for 10 minutes. </p><p>Remove the filter, and let it drain into the pan; make sure the O-ring comes off. Use your finger to coat the new filter's O-ring with a little oil. If the angle of the new filter allows, prefill it with oil and screw it on. Tighten a three-quarter turn after the gasket touches. Reinstall the drain plug with a new crush washer or seal. </p><p>Add all but the last quart of oil, start the engine and check for leaks. Turn off the car, let it sit for a few minutes, then check the oil level. Top off to the fill mark.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="19">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">20</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Fix an Outlet</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.1250%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c43ab1a9_-_25-skills-08-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c43ab1a9_-_25-skills-08-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="8. Fix a Dead Outlet" title="8. Fix a Dead Outlet" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c43ab1a9_-_25-skills-08-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fix%20an%20Outlet&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c43ab1a9_-_25-skills-08-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fix%20an%20Outlet&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c43ab1a9_-_25-skills-08-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>If the lamp goes out, but the bulb's not fried, it's time to check the outlet. Once you turn off the breaker, here's how to fix the usual suspects.</p><p>Detached Wire: Cut the damaged wire 1/8 in. from the end, strip 1/2 in. of insulation; reattach by bending the wire clockwise under the terminal screw and tighten.</p><p>Loose Push-In Connection: Reattach the loose wire on the back of the outlet under the appropriate terminal screw.</p><p>Loose Splice: Remove the wire connector and replace it with a pro-quality Ideal 341 or 3M Super Tan. Hold the stripped wires so their ends are even and tighten the new connector.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: To ensure that the splice is secure, gently tug on each wire.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="20">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">21</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Navigate with a Map and Compass</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.1250%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c43ede7a_-_25-skills-09-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c43ede7a_-_25-skills-09-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="9. Navigate With a Map and Compass" title="9. Navigate With a Map and Compass" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/320x426/54c88c43ede7a_-_25-skills-09-1007-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Navigate%20with%20a%20Map%20and%20Compass&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c43ede7a_-_25-skills-09-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Navigate%20with%20a%20Map%20and%20Compass&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F320x426%2F54c88c43ede7a_-_25-skills-09-1007-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Though GPS may seem ubiquitous, it doesn't work everywhere. Mountains and dense tree cover can knock out sat signals--and batteries can die. Here's how to roam the backcountry with a compass and topo map.</p><p>Orient the Map by aligning its magnetic north (MN) indicator with your compass's reading of MN.</p><p>Pencil the MN Line across the map, then anchor the map in this north-facing position; instead of turning the map as you head toward your destination, pivot around it as if switching seats at a table.</p><p>Draw a line between where you are and where you want to go. Once you turn toward the destination, the line of travel should be perpendicular to your chest.</p><p>Fold the map parallel to your line of travel, leaving a 2-in. margin on the side that you hold. Place the map between thumb and index finger and begin "thumbing the map"--use your thumb to check off terrain features as you travel so you can look away from the map without losing your bearings.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: "Estimate how long it will take to get to your destination. Then, as you pass landmarks, see if your estimate is holding up. It will give you confidence in your location. An adult male hiker takes 20 to 40 minutes per mile on flat to moderately sloping terrain." </p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="21">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">22</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Drive a Stick Shift</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbee162c_-_100-skills-065-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbee162c_-_100-skills-065-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="65. Drive a Stick Shift" title="65. Drive a Stick Shift" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbee162c_-_100-skills-065-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Drive%20a%20Stick%20Shift&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbee162c_-_100-skills-065-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Drive%20a%20Stick%20Shift&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbee162c_-_100-skills-065-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Teach your kids to master this vanishing art (only about 4 percent of new cars in the U.S. have sticks) and they'll save on the sticker, use less gas and be more attuned to the car. The initial learning curve can be stressful, so practice in empty parking lots or on level country roads. </p><p>Beginners tend to let the clutch out too fast while simultaneously stepping too hard on the gas. Instead, have your student rev the engine to a little above idle and try to hold it steady. Then have him practice easing the clutch in and out to control his speed in first gear. </p><p><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/a28461/how-to-drive-stick-manual-transmission/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/a28461/how-to-drive-stick-manual-transmission/">Read our complete guide: How to Drive a Stick Shift</a></p>
			</div>
</div>
