<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="22">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">23</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Take the Perfect Portrait</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb11f860_-_100-skills-005-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb11f860_-_100-skills-005-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="5. Take the Perfect Portrait" title="5. Take the Perfect Portrait" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb11f860_-_100-skills-005-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Take%20the%20Perfect%20Portrait&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb11f860_-_100-skills-005-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Take%20the%20Perfect%20Portrait&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb11f860_-_100-skills-005-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>To properly frame a face, opt for a zoom between 120 and 150 mm, says Lynn Donaldson, who shoots for <em>National Geographic Traveler</em>. Any wider and you risk exaggerating features. But zoom in too much and you can add the illusion of weight, because longer lenses compress space. </p><p>Opt for a simple background; avoid bright light directly in front of subjects (they'll squint) or behind them&mdash;automatic cameras darken the foreground until your subjects look like silhouettes. To counteract this, turn the flash on. "You can almost always use your flash in the sun," Donaldson says. "It evens out skin tones and makes wrinkles and dark circles disappear."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="23">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">24</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Frame a Wall</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c429ba8d_-_25-skills-04-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c429ba8d_-_25-skills-04-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="4. Frame a Wall" title="4. Frame a Wall" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c429ba8d_-_25-skills-04-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Frame%20a%20Wall&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c429ba8d_-_25-skills-04-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Frame%20a%20Wall&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c429ba8d_-_25-skills-04-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>It's the basic partition&mdash;an interior, non-load-bearing wall with a door opening. Here's how to frame it, so you can divide your basement into a really useful storage area and a totally indulgent man space&mdash;say, a big-screen sports den.</p><p>Hold the base and top plates together with their ends aligned, then measure 15 1/4 in. from the end farthest from the door opening. Draw a line across the edge of the plates and mark an X right of the line. From here, mark a series of lines--one for each stud--spaced 16 in. apart, with an X to the right of each. Mark the plates to indicate a door opening.</p><p>Separate the plates and nail studs to the right of each line. Use two common 16d nails driven through the plate at the top and bottom of each stud.</p><p>Single-frame door openings require four pieces of lumber. Measure your door; then make the opening 2 in. higher and wider. To remove the sill plate in the opening, use an eight-point crosscut saw to cut almost through. (Protect the floor with masking tape.) Knock out the piece with a hammer and clean it up with a chisel.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: Each stud has a slight arch known as a crown. Position studs with crowns facing the same way when you nail the wall together. This prevents the wall from looking wavy after it's complete." </p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="24">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">25</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Patch a Radiator Hose</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/54c88c41d5445_-_25-skills-01-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/54c88c41d5445_-_25-skills-01-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="1. Patch A Radiator Hose" title="1. Patch A Radiator Hose" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/54c88c41d5445_-_25-skills-01-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Patch%20a%20Radiator%20Hose&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F54c88c41d5445_-_25-skills-01-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Patch%20a%20Radiator%20Hose&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F54c88c41d5445_-_25-skills-01-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-copyright">Corbis</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Steam hissing from a ruptured radiator hose? Here's a relatively easy, temporary fix with duct tape.</p><p>Wait for the engine to cool off. Open the hood and locate the source of the steam--i.e., the rupture. Clean and dry the area around the fissure; the tape won't stick as well on a damp, dirty surface.<br>Wrap 2 to 3 in. of duct tape around the hose over the hole; press firmly.</p><p>Overwrap the patch (the hose will be under intense pressure) from 2 to 3 in. above the original piece to about 2 or 3 in. below, then work your way back. Check your radiator level before cranking the engine. "If it's seriously low and you don't have a can of coolant, use water or, in an emergency, diet soda," says Tony Molla of the National Institute of Automotive Service Excellence and former pro wrench jockey. "Avoid using fruit juice or anything with sugar or acids in it. It'll corrode the radiator and hoses."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="25">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">26</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Tape Drywall</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcafebc3e_-_100-skills-001-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcafebc3e_-_100-skills-001-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="1. Tape Drywall" title="1. Tape Drywall" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcafebc3e_-_100-skills-001-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Tape%20Drywall&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcafebc3e_-_100-skills-001-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Tape%20Drywall&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcafebc3e_-_100-skills-001-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Easy to do. Hard to do well. Spread a strip of compound about the width of your 5-in. drywall knife along the entire joint, then press the tape into the compound. </p><p>Use your knife to embed the tape; allow the excess compound to build up on the front of the blade, covering the tape in a thin layer. Repeat with a 4-in. knife to remove even more excess compound. Let the joint dry; sand lightly and repeat with an 8- or 10-in. blade. (The wider the band of compound, the smoother the joint.) Dip your knife in water occasionally to keep it clean and lubricated.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="26">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">27</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Stick Welder</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb3cc4a5_-_100-skills-017-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb3cc4a5_-_100-skills-017-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="17. Use a Stick Welder" title="17. Use a Stick Welder" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb3cc4a5_-_100-skills-017-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Stick%20Welder&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb3cc4a5_-_100-skills-017-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Stick%20Welder&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb3cc4a5_-_100-skills-017-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Michael Nemeth</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>"Stick welding is one of the simplest and most inexpensive ways to get into welding," Tocco says. (Some handymen prefer wire, or MIG, welding because it's faster.) The first step in stick welding: Set the amperage for the electrode size and metal thickness. To strike the arc, brush the electrode against the workpiece as if striking a match. </p><p>Hold the electrode at a 45-degree angle to the center of the joint and drag it along at a 15- to 20- degree lead angle, Tocco says. Maintaining a consistent arc of 1/8 in. or less, move the electrode slowly, so that the molten pool at the end of the electrode washes evenly into both pieces of metal.</p><p><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/tools/how-to/a15739/how-to-get-started-with-welding/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/tools/how-to/a15739/how-to-get-started-with-welding/">More: How to Get Started With Welding</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="27">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">28</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Grill with Charcoal</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb0401e0_-_100-skills-002-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb0401e0_-_100-skills-002-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="2. Grill with Charcoal" title="2. Grill with Charcoal" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb0401e0_-_100-skills-002-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Grill%20with%20Charcoal&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb0401e0_-_100-skills-002-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Grill%20with%20Charcoal&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb0401e0_-_100-skills-002-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Cluster the coals on one side of the grill with as little space between the briquettes as possible, says Jamie Purviance, author of Real Grilling. This minimizes airflow, which keeps coals burning longer. </p><p>For direct grilling (burgers, steaks, fish fillets), place the food above the burning coals. For lower-temperature, indirect grilling (chicken, ribs, roasts) place the food well away from the coals. Shut the lid; open it only to check whether the food is done. </p><p>You can also grill indirectly with gas. Preheat all burners on high, then turn them down on one side of the grill to the temperature needed for the recipe and completely off on the other.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="28">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">29</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Set Up a Ladder Safely</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb0d2972_-_100-skills-004-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb0d2972_-_100-skills-004-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="4. Set Up a Ladder,Safely" title="4. Set Up a Ladder,Safely" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb0d2972_-_100-skills-004-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Set%20Up%20a%20Ladder%20Safely&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb0d2972_-_100-skills-004-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Set%20Up%20a%20Ladder%20Safely&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb0d2972_-_100-skills-004-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Before stepping on the ladder, check that it's set at the correct angle, 75 to 78 degrees. Stand with the toes of your work boots against the ladder's base and extend your arms horizontally. The ladder is at a safe angle when you can just grasp the rung at shoulder level with arms fully extended.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="29">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">30</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Build a Shelter</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb1f1c67_-_100-skills-008-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb1f1c67_-_100-skills-008-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="8. Build a Shelter" title="8. Build a Shelter" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb1f1c67_-_100-skills-008-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Build%20a%20Shelter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb1f1c67_-_100-skills-008-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Build%20a%20Shelter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb1f1c67_-_100-skills-008-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Find a small dead tree about 10 to 12 ft. long to serve as a ridgepole. Lean it against a boulder, stump or the branch of a standing tree 3 to 4 ft. off the ground. Lean as many small branches as you can find against the ridgepole, then crisscross them with smaller sticks. </p><p>Finally, add a thick layer of leaves and grass, plus more sticks on top to keep the wind from blowing away your "roof." If time is short, or water and food are scarce, consider a more efficient, if less elegant, method: Make a big pile of leaves and grass and small debris and just dive in.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="30">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">31</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Ditch your Hard Drive</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb22d368_-_100-skills-009-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb22d368_-_100-skills-009-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="9. Ditch your Hard Drive" title="9. Ditch your Hard Drive" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb22d368_-_100-skills-009-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Ditch%20your%20Hard%20Drive&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb22d368_-_100-skills-009-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Ditch%20your%20Hard%20Drive&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb22d368_-_100-skills-009-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Your old hard drive holds a treasure trove of info for would-be identity thieves. Simply deleting your files or reformatting the drive won't truly blank the platters.</p><p>The basic strategy: Purchase disk-cleaning software, such as Evidence Eliminator or cyberCide, that eliminates files by writing zeros over all the bits&mdash;yet still leaves the drive usable for others. That way, instead of clogging up landfills, you can help out those in need. The <a href="http://www.cristina.org" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="http://www.cristina.org">National Cristina Foundation</a> donates old drives to schools and public agencies. </p><p>The paranoid strategy: Nothing beats good, old-fashioned physical destruction. Government agencies use professional hard-drive shredders; you can approximate the effect with a 12-in. drill bit. Use a drill driver to puncture the platter in at least four places. Your hard drive will have taken its last spin.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="31">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">32</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a French Knife</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb25b36c_-_100-skills-010-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb25b36c_-_100-skills-010-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="10. Use a French Knife" title="10. Use a French Knife" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb25b36c_-_100-skills-010-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20French%20Knife&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb25b36c_-_100-skills-010-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20French%20Knife&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb25b36c_-_100-skills-010-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Pick an 8-in. blade for most kitchen cutting. "The thinner and sharper your blade, the better the glide," says Harold Arimoto, president of MAC Knife. Grasp the rear of the blade between your thumb and forefinger, with your remaining fingers comfortably curled around the handle. </p><p>First, slice the veggie in half and lay the flat side down, so you'll have a solid base to work on. Then, using your opposite forefinger knuckle as a guide&mdash;which also keeps fingertips out of harm's way&mdash;cut down and forward with light pressure and a slight rocking motion.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="32">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">33</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Cast a Line</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb2a9991_-_100-skills-011-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb2a9991_-_100-skills-011-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="11. Cast a Line" title="11. Cast a Line" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb2a9991_-_100-skills-011-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Cast%20a%20Line&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb2a9991_-_100-skills-011-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Cast%20a%20Line&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb2a9991_-_100-skills-011-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>With the lure hanging 6 to 12 in. below the end of the rod, show your kid how to press and hold the reel's release button, then swiftly and smoothly bend his elbow and pull the rod back and up. </p><p>As the rod bends back past vertical, he should move his forearm forward and down with a slight wrist motion, gently sweeping the rod for-ward. As it passes vertical, tell him to release his thumb from the button. After a few tries, he'll get a feel for the precise release point that sends the lure flying far and true.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="33">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">34</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Fix That Check Engine Light</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb313597_-_100-skills-013-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb313597_-_100-skills-013-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="13. Check Trouble Codes" title="13. Check Trouble Codes" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb313597_-_100-skills-013-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fix%20That%20Check%20Engine%20Light&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb313597_-_100-skills-013-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fix%20That%20Check%20Engine%20Light&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb313597_-_100-skills-013-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Baffled by that annoying <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/a10411/check-engine-light/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/a10411/check-engine-light/">Check Engine light</a>? Plug the <a href="https://www.amazon.com/ANCEL-AD310-Enhanced-Universal-Diagnostic/dp/B01G5EA74I/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1533674715&amp;sr=8-3&amp;keywords=auto%20scan%20tool&amp;linkCode=ogi" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" class="product-links" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="scan tool" data-product-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01G5EA74I" data-affiliate-url="" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.amazon.com/ANCEL-AD310-Enhanced-Universal-Diagnostic/dp/B01G5EA74I/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1533674715&amp;sr=8-3&amp;keywords=auto scan tool&amp;linkCode=ogi" data-vars-ga-product-brand="ANCEL" data-vars-ga-product-id="bb7ad9b7-f740-4d0b-bfde-0fec2c95a71d" data-vars-ga-product-price="35.99" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-brand="ANCEL" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-category="Code Readers &amp; Scan Tools" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-id="" data-affiliate-network='{"id":"585e38ac-716f-4f92-9fbc-ca8721de9979","site_id":"a4f9566a-1fd0-484c-b731-150b9bda9ffa","is_active":true,"details":null,"metadata":[],"network":{"id":"469ce69f-4798-416d-9432-eaa9954b4053","name":"Amazon","is_active":true,"business_unit_id":"ad046b46-538b-42cb-aa54-c3d158875ed6","details":"","metadata":[],"created_at":"2021-07-28T16:03:03.241365+00:00","last_updated_at":"2021-07-28T16:03:03.241381+00:00"}}' data-affiliate="true">scan tool</a> into the OBD II port, a 16-pin connector under the dash. If you get a code, write it down to compare next time the light comes on. Some codes, called pending codes, don't turn on the light, but will still flunk you at inspection time, so scan before your next smog check.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="34">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">35</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Iron a Shirt</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb33bb6d_-_100-skills-014-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb33bb6d_-_100-skills-014-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="14. Iron a Shirt" title="14. Iron a Shirt" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb33bb6d_-_100-skills-014-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Iron%20a%20Shirt&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb33bb6d_-_100-skills-014-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Iron%20a%20Shirt&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb33bb6d_-_100-skills-014-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Forget the towel on the countertop; get an ironing board. (Think of it as a workbench.) First, spritz the shirt with a fine spray of water, advises Marc Borders, a wardrobe designer for the Jim Henson Company. "Steam irons don't always get every part of the shirt." </p><p>Start with the back of the collar, pressing tip to center. Then, with the small end of the board in the sleeve, press the back yoke (the piece between the shoulders and the sleeves). </p><p>Next, iron the sleeves, cuffs first, maintaining the crease from previous pressings. For the body of the shirt, start with the collar on the left, buttons up, rotating the shirt as you press. Keep the iron moving to avoid scorching.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="35">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">36</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Maneuver a Car Out of a Skid</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-freeform listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:75.0000%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c451fb00_-_25-skills-14-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c451fb00_-_25-skills-14-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="14. Maneuver a Car Out of a Skid" title="14. Maneuver a Car Out of a Skid" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/05/480x360/54c88c451fb00_-_25-skills-14-1007-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Maneuver%20a%20Car%20Out%20of%20a%20Skid&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c451fb00_-_25-skills-14-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Maneuver%20a%20Car%20Out%20of%20a%20Skid&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F05%2F480x360%2F54c88c451fb00_-_25-skills-14-1007-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Popular Mechanics</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Although there isn't much you can do when your car is pirouetting out of control, you can maneuver out of two basic types of skids before things get messy.</p><p>When the front tires slip, you're understeering or plowing (A). This occurs when a motorist takes a turn too fast, at too sharp an angle or uses the brake or throttle excessively. The tires lose grip and the car's momentum pushes it straight instead of through the curve. When you lose traction up front, steering has no effect; so slow down by gently reducing throttle. The tires will eventually grip and pull you in the direction you want to go.</p><p>Rear-wheel slippage is called oversteering or fishtailing (B). It happens during cornering when your rear wheels exceed the limit of their lateral traction before the front tires do, causing the rear of the vehicle to head toward the outside of the corner or front of the car. For rear-wheel slippage, you need to apply "CPR"--correction, pause and recovery. Correct by steering into the direction of the skid. Pause to let the unsprung weight of the car settle and the tires grip. Recover by steering the car straight; make your movements slow but sure.</p><p><strong>TIP</strong>: Look where you want the car to go. Stare at the pole, and you will hit the pole.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="36">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">37</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Paint a Straight Line</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb36726e_-_100-skills-015-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb36726e_-_100-skills-015-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="15. Paint a Straight Line" title="15. Paint a Straight Line" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb36726e_-_100-skills-015-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Paint%20a%20Straight%20Line&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb36726e_-_100-skills-015-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Paint%20a%20Straight%20Line&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb36726e_-_100-skills-015-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Professionals don't like masking tape; it can leak and pull up paint when removed. On a flat surface, paint the light color first, then snap or draw a chalk line over it. (Drywall corners, unlike trim lines or window sashes, are rarely straight; follow your line, not the corner.) Use a high-quality brush with fine bristles. Move it edgewise, slowly, with just enough pressure to bend the bristles out slightly. "You don't want too much paint on the brush to start," says pro painter Brian Doherty.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="37">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">38</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Tie a Bowline Knot</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb391fd3_-_100-skills-016-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb391fd3_-_100-skills-016-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="16. Tie a Bowline" title="16. Tie a Bowline" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb391fd3_-_100-skills-016-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Tie%20a%20Bowline%20Knot&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb391fd3_-_100-skills-016-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Tie%20a%20Bowline%20Knot&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb391fd3_-_100-skills-016-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Remember "The rabbit comes out of the hole, goes around the tree and goes back down the hole"? Still works.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="38">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">39</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Read an Electric Meter</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb407370_-_100-skills-018-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb407370_-_100-skills-018-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="18. Read an Electric Meter" title="18. Read an Electric Meter" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb407370_-_100-skills-018-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Read%20an%20Electric%20Meter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb407370_-_100-skills-018-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Read%20an%20Electric%20Meter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb407370_-_100-skills-018-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>To monitor energy savings, check your meter regularly. The key to deciphering the five-dial mechanical meter, says Jim Ward, a meter reader in Cornwall, N.Y.: "Read right to left." Write down the number on the fifth dial; round down. (The first, third and fifth dials turn clockwise; the second and fourth, counterclockwise.) Then, moving in order from right to left, note the numbers. The number you've written, read left to right, is your meter reading in kilowatt-hours.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="39">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">40</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Hang Food in the Wild</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb433fa4_-_100-skills-019-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb433fa4_-_100-skills-019-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="19. Hang Food in the Wild" title="19. Hang Food in the Wild" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb433fa4_-_100-skills-019-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Hang%20Food%20in%20the%20Wild&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb433fa4_-_100-skills-019-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Hang%20Food%20in%20the%20Wild&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb433fa4_-_100-skills-019-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Find two trees at least 20 ft. apart. Tie one end of a rope to the base of one tree, then toss it over a branch 15 to 20 ft. high. Throw the other end of the rope over an equally high branch on the second tree. Attach your bag to the rope in between, pull the line taut and secure the rope to the base of the second tree.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="40">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">41</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Solder Wire</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb46505d_-_100-skills-020-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb46505d_-_100-skills-020-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="20. Solder Wire" title="20. Solder Wire" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb46505d_-_100-skills-020-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Solder%20Wire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb46505d_-_100-skills-020-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Solder%20Wire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb46505d_-_100-skills-020-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Strip 1/2 in. of insulation off the ends of two wires, then slip 1 to 2 in. of PVC shrink tube along one of them, leaving the last 1/2 in. of the wire exposed. Twist the two sections of bare wire together, and heat the joint with a soldering iron from below. Apply solder along the top of the wires until molten solder wicks into the joint. Let it cool undisturbed. Slide the shrink tube over the joint and zap it with a heat gun.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="41">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">42</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Circular Saw</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb4bd03b_-_100-skills-021-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb4bd03b_-_100-skills-021-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="21. Circular saw" title="21. Circular saw" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb4bd03b_-_100-skills-021-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Circular%20Saw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb4bd03b_-_100-skills-021-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Circular%20Saw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb4bd03b_-_100-skills-021-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Novice cut: Use a square as a straightedge for accurate crosscuts on 2 x 6s and wider workpieces.</p><p>Advanced cut: The key to making a pocket cut in a plywood panel is to drop the blade down accurately onto the cut line. Draw a line perpendicular to the cut line, tilt the saw forward and align the toe of the base to the perpendicular line, then lower the blade slowly. Cut almost to the end; finish with a handsaw.</p><p><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/tools/reviews/a3769/4291889/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/tools/reviews/a3769/4291889/">More: 10 Circular Saw Secrets</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="42">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">43</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Spade Bit</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb4ee7a9_-_100-skills-022-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb4ee7a9_-_100-skills-022-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="22. Spade Bit" title="22. Spade Bit" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb4ee7a9_-_100-skills-022-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Spade%20Bit&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb4ee7a9_-_100-skills-022-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Spade%20Bit&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb4ee7a9_-_100-skills-022-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Fast and rough, these bits usually splinter the wood as they exit the hole. To make a cleaner hole, stop when the tip begins to break through the underside of the workpiece. Remove the bit, turn the workpiece over and place the tip in the exit hole. Complete the hole by boring in from the opposite side.</p><p><strong>Tip</strong>: Another way to avoid splintering: Clamp wood under the workpiece, then drill through it into the scrap.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="43">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">44</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use an Infrared Thermometer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb56026d_-_100-skills-023-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb56026d_-_100-skills-023-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="23. Infrared Thermometer" title="23. Infrared Thermometer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb56026d_-_100-skills-023-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20an%20Infrared%20Thermometer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb56026d_-_100-skills-023-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20an%20Infrared%20Thermometer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb56026d_-_100-skills-023-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>A <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Etekcity-Lasergrip-774-Non-contact-Thermometer/dp/B00837ZGRY/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1533674814&amp;sr=8-3&amp;keywords=infrared%20thermometer&amp;linkCode=ogi" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" class="product-links" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="thermometer" data-product-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00837ZGRY" data-affiliate-url="" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.amazon.com/Etekcity-Lasergrip-774-Non-contact-Thermometer/dp/B00837ZGRY/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1533674814&amp;sr=8-3&amp;keywords=infrared thermometer&amp;linkCode=ogi" data-vars-ga-product-brand="Etekcity" data-vars-ga-product-id="bd0da319-8292-4026-b460-bbb1181b7d86" data-vars-ga-product-price="27.99" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-brand="Etekcity" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-category="Kitchen &amp; Dining Features" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-id="" data-affiliate-network='{"id":"585e38ac-716f-4f92-9fbc-ca8721de9979","site_id":"a4f9566a-1fd0-484c-b731-150b9bda9ffa","is_active":true,"details":null,"metadata":[],"network":{"id":"469ce69f-4798-416d-9432-eaa9954b4053","name":"Amazon","is_active":true,"business_unit_id":"ad046b46-538b-42cb-aa54-c3d158875ed6","details":"","metadata":[],"created_at":"2021-07-28T16:03:03.241365+00:00","last_updated_at":"2021-07-28T16:03:03.241381+00:00"}}' data-affiliate="true">thermometer</a> that reads from several feet away has lots of uses: Check a radiator for plugged tubes, pinpoint a misfiring cylinder (the exhaust manifold will be colder near the misfire), monitor trailer bearings and tires and look for insulation leaks in your house.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="44">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">45</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Chisel Wood</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb58e40a_-_100-skills-024-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb58e40a_-_100-skills-024-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="24. Wood Chisel" title="24. Wood Chisel" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb58e40a_-_100-skills-024-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Chisel%20Wood&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb58e40a_-_100-skills-024-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Chisel%20Wood&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb58e40a_-_100-skills-024-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>To make a vertical chopping cut <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(1)</strong>, place the chisel at least 1/8 in. inside the cut line, with the bevel facing the waste side of the cut, and strike the tool firmly with a mallet. (You can use a hammer on chisels with metal end caps.) To remove the wood chip <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(2)</strong>, hold the chisel with the bevel face down and take scooping cuts toward the vertical cut you just made. To finish the cut <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(3)</strong>, pare vertically down to the line by holding the chisel like a dagger. </p><p><strong>Tip</strong>: Make several thin paring cuts rather than trying to remove the wood in one pass.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="45">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">46</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Hacksaw</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb614de8_-_100-skills-026-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb614de8_-_100-skills-026-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="26. Hacksaw" title="26. Hacksaw" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb614de8_-_100-skills-026-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Hacksaw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb614de8_-_100-skills-026-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Hacksaw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb614de8_-_100-skills-026-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>It doesn't respond well to pressure; use light strokes. On smooth, hard surfaces, mark the cut line with a carbide scriber <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(1)</strong> or file a starting notch. Use your thumbnail <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(2)</strong> as a guide to start. Apply cutting pressure only on the push stroke <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(3)</strong>; lift the blade on the return stroke. Blades with 18 to 24 teeth per inch (tpi) are the most useful and versatile: Use 14 tpi for soft, thick metals (bar stock made of aluminum, copper or brass); 18 to 24 tpi for solid steel channel and pipe; 28 to 32 tpi for thin-wall armored electrical cable and sheetmetal.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="46">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">47</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Torque Wrench</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb643e97_-_100-skills-027-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb643e97_-_100-skills-027-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="27. Torque Wrench" title="27. Torque Wrench" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb643e97_-_100-skills-027-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Torque%20Wrench&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb643e97_-_100-skills-027-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Torque%20Wrench&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb643e97_-_100-skills-027-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>
