<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Using a torque wrench the wrong way leads to incorrectly tightened fasteners, which can spell trouble for your machinery. To do it right, first screw the fasteners on by hand. Some are torqued dry, some lightly oiled--check your shop manual. </p><p>Next, pick a wrench-- a beam-type is less expensive, but the <a href="https://www.amazon.com/TEKTON-24335-2-Inch-ft-lb-13-6-203-5/dp/B00C5ZL0RU/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1533674395&amp;sr=8-3&amp;keywords=torque%20wrench&amp;linkCode=ogi" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" class="product-links" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="click-type" data-product-url="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00C5ZL0RU" data-affiliate-url="" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.amazon.com/TEKTON-24335-2-Inch-ft-lb-13-6-203-5/dp/B00C5ZL0RU/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1533674395&amp;sr=8-3&amp;keywords=torque wrench&amp;linkCode=ogi" data-vars-ga-product-brand="TEKTON" data-vars-ga-product-id="795897dd-6f2d-4e9c-94c2-96f2a517581d" data-vars-ga-product-price="42.00" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-brand="TEKTON" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-category="Torque Wrenches" data-vars-ga-product-sem3-id="" data-affiliate-network='{"id":"585e38ac-716f-4f92-9fbc-ca8721de9979","site_id":"a4f9566a-1fd0-484c-b731-150b9bda9ffa","is_active":true,"details":null,"metadata":[],"network":{"id":"469ce69f-4798-416d-9432-eaa9954b4053","name":"Amazon","is_active":true,"business_unit_id":"ad046b46-538b-42cb-aa54-c3d158875ed6","details":"","metadata":[],"created_at":"2021-07-28T16:03:03.241365+00:00","last_updated_at":"2021-07-28T16:03:03.241381+00:00"}}' data-affiliate="true">click-type</a> can be easier to use. </p><p>To use a beam wrench, first make sure it zeros; bend the pointer if necessary. Turn the wrench steadily, holding the plastic handle so it floats on the pivot to the beam to avoid influencing the readings with your hands. <br><br>With a click wrench, twist the handle until you see the desired torque in the indicator window. Tighten the wrench until you feel the mechanism click, but no farther. With both wrenches, tighten all fasteners gradually, starting in the middle of the assembly and working in a widening spiral. Begin with one-third of the final torque; return to the first fastener and tighten all to two-thirds of the final torque. Repeat, in sequence, to the final torque.</p><p><strong>Tip</strong>: For something like an oil pan with multiple fasteners, turn them all on two threads before finger-tightening any of them, or the last ones will be hard to start.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="47">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">48</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Framing Hammer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb6ea6e9_-_100-skills-030-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb6ea6e9_-_100-skills-030-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="30. Framing Hammer" title="30. Framing Hammer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb6ea6e9_-_100-skills-030-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Framing%20Hammer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb6ea6e9_-_100-skills-030-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Framing%20Hammer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb6ea6e9_-_100-skills-030-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>It looks easy, but hammering a nail is a skill. Right-handers, stand or kneel with your left foot forward. Hold the hammer just above the knob at the handle's base, with most of the gripping action coming from your thumb, pinky, ring finger and middle finger. Hold the nail between thumb and forefinger with your left hand and tap until it stands in the wood. Take your fingers away and draw back the hammer until the claw is at or just behind your shoulder. Swing forward with a fluid stroke. </p><p><strong>Tip</strong>: To prevent a stud from moving laterally when toenailing it to a plate or header, place the toe of your boot behind the stud.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="48">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">49</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Grease gun</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb72d35e_-_100-skills-031-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb72d35e_-_100-skills-031-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="31. Grease gun" title="31. Grease gun" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb72d35e_-_100-skills-031-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Grease%20gun&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb72d35e_-_100-skills-031-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Grease%20gun&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb72d35e_-_100-skills-031-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Clean the grease fitting with a rag to avoid injecting abrasive dirt. Flexible, right-angle or other specialized ends for the gun help access odd or hard-to-reach fittings. Pump the gun until grease oozes out of the boot. </p><p><strong data-redactor-tag="strong"><em data-redactor-tag="em"></em></strong><strong>Tip</strong>: Load the gun by hand with the best synthetic wheel-bearing grease; it has double the lifetime of the cheap white lithium chassis grease that comes in cartridges.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="49">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">50</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use an Air-Impact Wrench</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb75b3d5_-_100-skills-032-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb75b3d5_-_100-skills-032-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="32. Air-Impact Wrench" title="32. Air-Impact Wrench" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb75b3d5_-_100-skills-032-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20an%20Air-Impact%20Wrench&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb75b3d5_-_100-skills-032-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20an%20Air-Impact%20Wrench&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb75b3d5_-_100-skills-032-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>This baby delivers real grunt for removing stuck lugs or crank bolts. Short, large-bore hoses to the compressor minimize pressure drop, ensuring full torque. Small-bore hoses work best with low-air-demand tools. To reinstall lug nuts, use a torque wrench; the air wrench can easily overtighten them. </p><p><strong data-redactor-tag="strong"><em data-redactor-tag="em"></em></strong><strong>Tip</strong>: Be sure to use special impact sockets; normal sockets can grenade under the huge torque.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="50">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">51</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Drill Driver</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb78c369_-_100-skills-033-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb78c369_-_100-skills-033-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="33. Drill Driver" title="33. Drill Driver" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb78c369_-_100-skills-033-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Drill%20Driver&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb78c369_-_100-skills-033-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Drill%20Driver&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb78c369_-_100-skills-033-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Okay, your new trophy tool has officially upped the firepower in your DIY arsenal. Here's drill-driver 101: Use the low-speed, high-torque range for driving screws and the high-speed, low-torque range for most drilling. There's also an adjustable torque-limiter ring to prevent stripped threads and damage to the motor. Set it high for long screws or hard material, low for soft material. </p><p><strong data-redactor-tag="strong">Tip<em>: </em></strong>A combo drill/driver bit is handy, especially with hardwoods. Use the drill end <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(1)</strong> for pilot holes, then reverse the bit and use the drill <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(2)</strong> to drive screws.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="51">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">52</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Hand Plane</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb7c542f_-_100-skills-034-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb7c542f_-_100-skills-034-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="34. Hand Plane" title="34. Hand Plane" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb7c542f_-_100-skills-034-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Hand%20Plane&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb7c542f_-_100-skills-034-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Hand%20Plane&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb7c542f_-_100-skills-034-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>At the start of a cut, apply downward pressure on the knob. Past the midway point, start to shift pressure to the handle, where all of it should be placed by the time the plane leaves the board.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="52">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">53</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Socket Wrench</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb8069b7_-_100-skills-035-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb8069b7_-_100-skills-035-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="35. Socket Wrench" title="35. Socket Wrench" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb8069b7_-_100-skills-035-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Socket%20Wrench&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb8069b7_-_100-skills-035-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Socket%20Wrench&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb8069b7_-_100-skills-035-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Among fledgling homeowners, socket-wrench abuse is epidemic&mdash;and you don't want to catch the bug. First, keep the tool clean and dry. The ratchet drive mechanism won't tolerate much moisture, dirt or the presence of metal particles. No sense bruising knuckles trying to get the tool into impossible places; buy a wrench with an articulating head and get at least one matching extension bar for it. Finally, be meticulous about keeping all those little sockets in their proper slots&mdash;it'll save you unending frustration in the future. </p><p><strong data-redactor-tag="strong"><em data-redactor-tag="em">CLASSIC MISTAKE:</em></strong> Overdoing the torque. Never slip a pipe over the tool's handle or hit it with a hammer. Save rusted or overtightened nuts for a manual impact driver and impact-rated socket.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="53">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">54</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Multimeter</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb85e0b2_-_100-skills-037-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb85e0b2_-_100-skills-037-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="37. Multimeter" title="37. Multimeter" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb85e0b2_-_100-skills-037-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Multimeter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb85e0b2_-_100-skills-037-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Multimeter&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb85e0b2_-_100-skills-037-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Always set the meter to the lowest scale that includes your target reading (usually 20 volts for 12-volt circuits). Back-probe connectors; inserting probes into the sockets can damage them. </p><p><strong data-redactor-tag="strong"><em data-redactor-tag="em">HEADS UP:</em></strong> Car wiring is DC and household wiring is AC, so use the appropriate scales. The current scale (amps) has an upper limit; drawing more current than the meter is rated for will blow a fuse.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="54">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">55</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Brick Trowel</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb88dd21_-_100-skills-038-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb88dd21_-_100-skills-038-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="38. Brick Trowel" title="38. Brick Trowel" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb88dd21_-_100-skills-038-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Brick%20Trowel&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb88dd21_-_100-skills-038-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Brick%20Trowel&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb88dd21_-_100-skills-038-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Slice down into the mortar pile as if you were cutting a piece of cake. With a quick flick, slide the mortar onto the course of bricks <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(1)</strong>. Smooth into a layer, then make a furrow with the tip of the trowel <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(2)</strong>. Lay a brick in the furrow and press down to squeeze out excess mortar. Level the brick. Scrape off the squeezed-out mortar <strong data-redactor-tag="strong">(3)</strong> and use it to "butter" the exposed end of the brick you just placed.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="55">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">56</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Sledgehammer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb8d22c3_-_100-skills-039-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb8d22c3_-_100-skills-039-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="39. Sledgehammer" title="39. Sledgehammer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb8d22c3_-_100-skills-039-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Sledgehammer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb8d22c3_-_100-skills-039-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Sledgehammer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb8d22c3_-_100-skills-039-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Chad Hunt</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>To hammer rock-breaking pins or to pound stakes, use the "driving swing." The basic stance: feet shoulder-width apart, knees flexed. Place your left hand at the base of the handle, just above its flare, and your right hand behind the hammerhead. raise the hammer above your head and slide your right hand down to the base. Power the hammer down through its arc with your upper body, your left hand pulling the handle down as the right pushes and steers. <strong data-redactor-tag="strong"><em data-redactor-tag="em">TIP:</em></strong> for maximum accuracy, keep your eye on the target&mdash;the way you'd keep your eye on the ball at home plate.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="56">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">57</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Use a Crosscut Saw</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb90fb59_-_100-skills-040-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb90fb59_-_100-skills-040-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="40. Crosscut Saw" title="40. Crosscut Saw" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb90fb59_-_100-skills-040-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Crosscut%20Saw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb90fb59_-_100-skills-040-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Use%20a%20Crosscut%20Saw&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb90fb59_-_100-skills-040-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Hold it at a shallow angle to the wood and make a few light backward strokes to form a groove on the cut line. Tip the saw up to 45 degrees and stroke forward using as much of the blade's length as you can. Ease off pressure on the backstroke. </p><p><strong>Tip</strong>: To keep the saw on course, sight along the cut line slightly ahead of where the blade is cutting.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="57">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">58</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Put Out a Fire</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb95982a_-_100-skills-041-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb95982a_-_100-skills-041-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="41. Put Out a Fire" title="41. Put Out a Fire" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb95982a_-_100-skills-041-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Put%20Out%20a%20Fire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb95982a_-_100-skills-041-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Put%20Out%20a%20Fire&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb95982a_-_100-skills-041-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


								
<div class="image-credit listicle-slide-credit">
	<span class="image-photo-credit">Mark Asnin</span></div>

			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>According to the National Fire Incident Reporting System, 94 percent of the time a fire extinguisher is employed, a blaze is snuffed out within 2 minutes. A simple acronym&mdash;PASS&mdash;helps firefighters remember how to use an extinguisher properly. </p><p>Stand back from the flames&mdash;about 8 ft. if possible&mdash;near an exit, and pull the pin in the handle. Keeping the extinguisher upright, aim the nozzle at the base of the fire (hitting the flames directly does nothing to put out the blaze). </p><p>Squeeze the lever to discharge pressurized dry chemical and sweep from side to side until the fire is out. "One of the worst things you can do if a grease fire starts," Cobbs says, "is to try to move the skillet to the sink. You'll splash flaming grease everywhere and run a high risk of burning yourself&mdash;not to mention spreading the fire."</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="58">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">59</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Change a Diaper</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb9b3d7b_-_100-skills-043-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb9b3d7b_-_100-skills-043-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="43. Change a Diaper" title="43. Change a Diaper" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb9b3d7b_-_100-skills-043-1008-lgn.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Change%20a%20Diaper&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb9b3d7b_-_100-skills-043-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Change%20a%20Diaper&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb9b3d7b_-_100-skills-043-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>If you're okay with cleaning gunk out of gutters, diapers should be no problem. Lay the baby on his or her back on a firm padded surface with side railings (or on the floor). Unfasten and open the diaper. With one hand, gently grasp the baby by the ankles; raise the baby's bottom and slide out the diaper. Still holding the ankles, clean the baby's bottom with a sanitary wipe or a wet cloth, wiping downward to keep the genitals clean. Slide the new diaper under the baby, lower the legs and release the ankles; fold up and fasten the diaper.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="59">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">60</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Drive in Snow</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb9e7bab_-_100-skills-044-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb9e7bab_-_100-skills-044-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="44. Drive in Snow" title="44. Drive in Snow" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcb9e7bab_-_100-skills-044-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Drive%20in%20Snow&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb9e7bab_-_100-skills-044-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Drive%20in%20Snow&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcb9e7bab_-_100-skills-044-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Use snow tires on all four corners. (On nondriving wheels, they maintain traction and prevent spinouts during braking or steering.) Tall, narrow tires have more contact pressure than wide ones do, so they're better at cutting through snow down to pavement. Apply throttle sparingly to keep the wheels from breaking loose. Traction is poorest at near-freezing temperatures, when the pressure of the tires melts snow or ice into a thin, slick film of water.</p><p>More: <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/g2457/how-to-drive-in-winter-12-hacks-from-the-pros-of-to-master-travel-in-snow-and-ice/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/g2457/how-to-drive-in-winter-12-hacks-from-the-pros-of-to-master-travel-in-snow-and-ice/">Winter Driving Tips From the Pros</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="60">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">61</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Remove Bloodstains from Fabric</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba42b8d_-_100-skills-045-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba42b8d_-_100-skills-045-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="45. Remove Bloodstains from Fabric" title="45. Remove Bloodstains from Fabric" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba42b8d_-_100-skills-045-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Remove%20Bloodstains%20from%20Fabric&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcba42b8d_-_100-skills-045-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Remove%20Bloodstains%20from%20Fabric&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcba42b8d_-_100-skills-045-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>The two rules: Move fast and use only cold water. If the blood is still wet, blot first with a paper towel. (Don't rub; that only makes it worse.) Rinse with mild detergent. If some stain remains, spray on Windex (ammonia) and soak again. Last resort: hydrogen peroxide before a final cold soak. Then wash normally in cold water; don't heat-dry until the stain is gone.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="61">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">62</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Fell a Tree</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba6e629_-_100-skills-046-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba6e629_-_100-skills-046-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="46. Fell a Tree" title="46. Fell a Tree" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba6e629_-_100-skills-046-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fell%20a%20Tree&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcba6e629_-_100-skills-046-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Fell%20a%20Tree&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcba6e629_-_100-skills-046-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>First, determine which way the tree will fall. (If it looks like a tossup, call in a professional; perfectly vertical specimens require ropes to pull the tree in the desired direction.) At a comfortable waist level, make a horizontal cut on the side where the tree is going to fall, stopping about a third of the way through the tree. Then make a wedge cut down to the same line. The notch should open toward the direction of fall. Make sure you have a clear 45-degree rear escape route before starting the back cut, aimed slightly above the V of the notch. When the tree starts to move, quickly withdraw the saw and retreat to safety. Yelling Timmmberrr! is strictly optional.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="62">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">63</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Ride a Bike</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba9d11f_-_100-skills-047-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba9d11f_-_100-skills-047-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="47. Ride a Bike" title="47. Ride a Bike" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcba9d11f_-_100-skills-047-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Ride%20a%20Bike&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcba9d11f_-_100-skills-047-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Ride%20a%20Bike&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcba9d11f_-_100-skills-047-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Remember teetering precariously on a bike while your dad ran behind holding the seat? There's a better way: Start with a bike small enough to allow the child to plant both feet on the ground. Then remove the pedals. Most kids begin using the bike like a scooter, pushing themselves along with their feet. Then they start lifting their feet to coast, which gives them the hang of balancingwhich is much easier to learn without the distraction of pedaling. Next thing you know, they beg you to put the pedals back on so they can ride farther and faster.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="63">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">64</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Conquer an Off-Road Obstacle</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbadc3d8_-_100-skills-048-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbadc3d8_-_100-skills-048-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="48. Conquer an Off-Road Obstacle" title="48. Conquer an Off-Road Obstacle" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbadc3d8_-_100-skills-048-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Conquer%20an%20Off-Road%20Obstacle&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbadc3d8_-_100-skills-048-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Conquer%20an%20Off-Road%20Obstacle&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbadc3d8_-_100-skills-048-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>It comes down to tire placement. Think: Rubber first. Approach the rock or ledge slowly, using first gear and low range in the 4wd system. Aim the driver's side tire (or passenger's side, depending on the obstacle's location) for the rock or ledge at a slight angle, so the rubber hits before the bumper or fender. Once the tire finds traction and begins to pull the vehicle up, raise your sightline to see farther down the trail. If the tires spin, don't floor it. Instead, ease off the gas slightly and saw the wheel back and forth, which helps the tires hunt for traction.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-portrait listicle-slide-image " data-id="64">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">65</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Whittle Wood</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-legacy listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap" style="padding-bottom:133.3333%">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbb2d740_-_100-skills-049-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 40.625rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbb2d740_-_100-skills-049-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="49. Whittle" title="49. Whittle" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbb2d740_-_100-skills-049-1008-de.jpg?fill=320:426&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Whittle%20Wood&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbb2d740_-_100-skills-049-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Whittle%20Wood&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbb2d740_-_100-skills-049-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Pushing cut: If you're righthanded, place your right thumb at the base of the blade. Wrap your left hand around the workpiece so that your left thumb touches the back of the blade's midpoint. Use even pressure and both thumbs to push the blade. Paring cut: Hold the underside of the workpiece in your left hand. With your right thumb under it, draw the knife toward you with the fingers of your right hand.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="65">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">66</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Hitch Up a Trailer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbbaddba_-_100-skills-051-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbbaddba_-_100-skills-051-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="51. Hitch Up a Trailer" title="51. Hitch Up a Trailer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbbaddba_-_100-skills-051-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Hitch%20Up%20a%20Trailer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbbaddba_-_100-skills-051-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Hitch%20Up%20a%20Trailer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbbaddba_-_100-skills-051-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>To confirm that the hitch is secure on the ball, lift the rear of the tow vehicle a couple of inches with the trailer tongue jack. Cross the breakaway chains under the tongue to prevent it from dragging on the pavement in case of a breakaway. To save yourself repeated trips to the rear of the trailer to check lights, turn on both the running lights and four-way flashers simultaneously.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="66">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">67</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Sew a Button</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbbe0188_-_100-skills-052-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbbe0188_-_100-skills-052-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="52. Sew a Button" title="52. Sew a Button" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbbe0188_-_100-skills-052-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Sew%20a%20Button&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbbe0188_-_100-skills-052-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Sew%20a%20Button&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbbe0188_-_100-skills-052-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Thread 18 in. of thread through the eye of a needle, forming two strands of equal length. Roll the ends together to make a knot, then rub the thread with candle wax. "It won't tangle as much," says wardrobe designer Marc Borders. Push the needle up through the fabric where the button will be, extending the thread fully to anchor the knot. Slide the button over the needle and down onto the fabric. Place a safety pin between the button and fabric as a temporary spacer. Thread the needle back down through another hole in the button and through the fabric. Repeat until you're almost out of thread, then bring the needle up through the cloth, remove the safety pin, and wrap the thread six times around the other strands underneath the button. Thread the needle back down through the cloth.</p><p><a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/interior-projects/how-to/a28379/sewing-skills-diy/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/interior-projects/how-to/a28379/sewing-skills-diy/">More: How to Sew by Hand</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="67">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">68</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Throw a Spiral</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbc148d6_-_100-skills-053-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbc148d6_-_100-skills-053-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="53. Throw a Spiral" title="53. Throw a Spiral" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbc148d6_-_100-skills-053-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Throw%20a%20Spiral&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbc148d6_-_100-skills-053-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Throw%20a%20Spiral&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbc148d6_-_100-skills-053-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Autumn's the season to teach this skill. Former Giants Super Bowl QB Phil Simms advises placing the middle and ring fingers over the laces and the index finger just behind them, thumb below. (Smaller hands can grab the ball closer to the point.) Cup the ball with the other hand and bring it next to the ear, pointing the opposite shoulder in the direction you wish to throw. As you finish the throw, flick the wrist downward to impart spin.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="68">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">69</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Homebrew Beer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbd8c7bc_-_100-skills-059-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbd8c7bc_-_100-skills-059-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="59. Home-Brew Beer" title="59. Home-Brew Beer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbd8c7bc_-_100-skills-059-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Homebrew%20Beer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbd8c7bc_-_100-skills-059-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Homebrew%20Beer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbd8c7bc_-_100-skills-059-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Go your local microbrew one better. Mix 4 to 5 pounds of malt extract with 5 gal. of water. Boil vigorously for an hour, adding the desired amount and variety of hops at the start and again after 45 minutes of boiling. Cool quickly, then pour into a fermenter and add yeast. "That's what gives beer its fizz," says Todd Frye, owner of the Home Brewery. Let the mixture ferment for two to three weeks, then add 1/12 cups of corn sugar. Bottle a batch in sterilized glass, seal it and let it sit for three to six weeks.</p><p>More: <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/how-to-plans/how-to/g466/the-starters-guide-to-brewing-beer/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.popularmechanics.com/home/how-to-plans/how-to/g466/the-starters-guide-to-brewing-beer/">How to Homebrew Beer</a></p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="69">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">70</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Replace a Fan Belt</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbdf052b_-_100-skills-061-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbdf052b_-_100-skills-061-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="61. Replace a Fan Belt" title="61. Replace a Fan Belt" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbdf052b_-_100-skills-061-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Replace%20a%20Fan%20Belt&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbdf052b_-_100-skills-061-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Replace%20a%20Fan%20Belt&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbdf052b_-_100-skills-061-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Cut off the old belt with a knife. Inspect for possible causes of failure, such as misaligned pulleys, rubber buildup in the grooves or a worn-out tensioner spring. If everything checks out, install the new belt by unloading the idler pulley and slipping it into place. (Check the owner's manual; the belt routing can be complex.)</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="70">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">71</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Mix Concrete</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbe79455_-_100-skills-063-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbe79455_-_100-skills-063-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="63. Mix Concrete" title="63. Mix Concrete" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbe79455_-_100-skills-063-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Mix%20Concrete&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbe79455_-_100-skills-063-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Mix%20Concrete&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbe79455_-_100-skills-063-1008-lgn.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>If you're going to use more than a cubic yard of concrete--a 9 x 9-ft. pad, 4 in. thick--call a Redi-Mix vendor. But for smaller jobs like a deck landing or fencepost footings, you can do it yourself with a hoe, shovel and wheel-barrow. Rule of thumb: A bag of portland cement makes about one- sixth of a cubic yard--or about a 44-in. square, 4 in. thick.</p><p>Mix 2 1/2 shovels of sand and 2 1/2 of gravel to each shovel of cement. (Exact proportions vary with the size of the aggregate--aka sand and gravel.)</p><p>Shovel the aggregate and cement into a wheelbarrow. Mix in water cautiously; a drier mix makes stronger concrete. When the mixture is gray/green, form a handful into a 3-in. ball. Toss it from one hand to the other. Too dry, and it will crumble; if it splatters, it's too wet. Correct the consistency with the appropriate ingredient. Don't let the concrete dry for more than an hour between loads.</p><p>Cure the poured concrete by keeping it moist for three to seven days&mdash;cover it with plastic or sprinkle water on it so the surface stays damp.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="71">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">72</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Replace a Faucet Washer</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbf7846a_-_100-skills-068-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbf7846a_-_100-skills-068-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="68. Replace a Faucet Washer" title="68. Replace a Faucet Washer" class="lazyimage lazyload" data-src="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcbf7846a_-_100-skills-068-1008-de.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=480:*"></picture></span>
		
		
							<div class="social-button-group slide-social-button-group" data-share-location="social-btns-image">
	 <div class="social-button social-button-pinterest slide-social-button social-share-button" role="none" data-tracking-id="share-button-pinterest">
	
	<a aria-label="Share on Pinterest" class="social-button-link" href="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Replace%20a%20Faucet%20Washer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbf7846a_-_100-skills-068-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A" target="_blank" data-pin-do="nothing" data-social-key="pinterest" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="//pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.popularmechanics.com%2Fhome%2Fg87%2Fskills-everyone-should-know%2F&amp;description=Replace%20a%20Faucet%20Washer&amp;media=https%3A%2F%2Fhips.hearstapps.com%2Fpop.h-cdn.co%2Fassets%2Fcm%2F15%2F06%2F54cfbcbf7846a_-_100-skills-068-1008-de.jpg%3Fresize%3D1600%3A%2A">
		<span class="icon social-button-icon icon-pinterest " aria-hidden="true"></span>

		
			</a>
</div>

</div>

			</div>
</div>


			</div>
	
	<div class="listicle-slide-dek">
					<p>Pry the cap off the handle and unscrew the screw beneath it. Below that is the stem, or bonnet nut, which may be recessed and require a socket wrench. (Careful, it's soft metal.) One more screw underneath to take out, and then voil&Atilde;&mdash;the washer. Once the new washer is in place, grease the stem and replace everything in reverse order.</p>
			</div>
</div>



							


		

<div class="listicle-slide listicle-slide-landscape listicle-slide-image " data-id="72">
	<div class="listicle-slide-hed">
					<span class="listicle-slide-hed-number">73</span>
		
		
		<span class="listicle-slide-hed-text">Tie a Necktie</span>
	</div>

	
			<div class="listicle-slide-media-outer">
		









<div class="slide-media slide-media-4x3 listicle-slide-media listicle-slide-media-image">
	<div class="slide-media-inner">
							<span class="slide-image-wrap">
						
	
			<picture class=""><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc021270_-_100-skills-070-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=980:*" media="(min-width: 48rem)"></source><source data-srcset="https://hips.hearstapps.com/pop.h-cdn.co/assets/cm/15/06/54cfbcc021270_-_100-skills-070-1008-lgn.jpg?crop=1xw:1.0xh;center,top&amp;resize=768:*" media="(min-width: 30rem)"></source><img alt="70. Tie a Necktie" title="70.
